text: The 2005–06 season was Blackpool F.C.'s 98th season (95th consecutive) in the Football League. It was also their fifth consecutive season in the third tier of English football. They finished in nineteenth place. Colin Hendry was succeeded by Simon Grayson as caretaker-manager in November 2005. Keigan Parker was the club's top scorer, with thirteen goals (twelve in the league and one in the League Cup). ==Table== == References == Category:Blackpool F.C. seasons Blackpool
title: 2005–06 Blackpool F.C. season
